title.value: Comparison of multi-center MRI protocols for visualizing the spinal cord gray matter
title.justification: The title is clearly stated at the beginning of the paper.
title.quote: Comparison of multi-center MRI protocols for visualizing the spinal cord gray matter

extractions.description: The paper compares various MRI protocols at different field strengths for visualizing the spinal cord gray matter. It evaluates the quality of spinal cord gray matter scans using quantitative metrics and qualitative assessments across multiple centers, aiming to optimize imaging protocols.

type.justification: The paper involves experimental comparisons of MRI protocols using data from multiple imaging centers.
type.quote: The purpose of this work was to compare various MRI protocols at 1.5 T, 3 T and 7 T for visualizing the gray matter. Methods: In vivo data of the cervical spinal cord were collected from nine different imaging centers.

name.justification: The paper focuses on MRI protocols for imaging the spinal cord, which falls under the Medical Imaging category.
name.quote: Purpose: Spinal cord gray matter imaging is valuable for a number of applications, but remains challenging.

name.justification: The paper specifically discusses MRI protocols and their optimization at different field strengths.
name.quote: The purpose of this work was to compare various MRI protocols at 1.5 T, 3 T and 7 T for visualizing the gray matter.

name.justification: The imaging focus on spinal cord gray matter for neurological assessment places this work within the Neuroimaging field.
name.quote: Imaging the spinal cord (SC) gray matter is useful for assessing atrophy in motor-neuron diseases such as amyotrophic lateral sclerosis.

name.justification: CNNs were used for the automatic segmentation of the spinal cord and gray matter.
name.quote: Automatic segmentation of the spinal cord and intramedullary multiple sclerosis lesions with convolutional neural networks.

is_contributed.justification: The paper references the use of CNNs for segmentation but does not indicate it as a contribution of this work.
is_contributed.quote: Automatic segmentation of the spinal cord and intramedullary multiple sclerosis lesions with convolutional neural networks.

is_executed.justification: There is no mention of executing the CNN model in the paper's experiments.
is_executed.quote: Automatic segmentation of the spinal cord and intramedullary multiple sclerosis lesions with convolutional neural networks.

is_compared.justification: The CNN model is not compared to other models within the study.
is_compared.quote: Automatic segmentation of the spinal cord and intramedullary multiple sclerosis lesions with convolutional neural networks.

referenced_paper_title.value: Automatic segmentation of the spinal cord and intramedullary multiple sclerosis lesions with convolutional neural networks
referenced_paper_title.justification: The referenced paper title is given when describing the CNN-based segmentation method.
referenced_paper_title.quote: Automatic segmentation of the spinal cord and intramedullary multiple sclerosis lesions with convolutional neural networks.

name.justification: The PAM50 template was used for simulations and evaluations in the study.
name.quote: Each phantom consisted of 10 slices extracted from the PAM50 template.

referenced_paper_title.value: PAM50: Unbiased multimodal template of the brainstem and spinal cord aligned with the ICBM152 space
referenced_paper_title.justification: The PAM50 template and its associated reference are used in the methodology section.
referenced_paper_title.quote: Each phantom consisted of 10 slices extracted from the PAM50 template (25) centered at the mid-C4 vertebral level.

name.justification: The dataset from the Spine-generic project was used for protocol comparison.
name.quote: We ran the same processing on an open-access multi-center dataset of the spinal cord MRI (n = 267 participants).

referenced_paper_title.value: Open-access quantitative MRI data of the spinal cord and reproducibility across participants, sites and manufacturers
referenced_paper_title.justification: The paper mentions using this dataset for comparisons with submitted protocols.
referenced_paper_title.quote: Because the gm-challenge protocols and the spine-generic protocol focused on different FOVs of different sizes, a direct and fair comparison is not fully possible.

name.justification: The SCT was explicitly mentioned as being used for quantitative assessments of MRI protocols.
name.quote: All quantitative assessments were done automatically using the Spinal Cord Toolbox (SCT).

referenced_paper_title.value: SCT: Spinal Cord Toolbox, an open-source software for processing spinal cord MRI data
referenced_paper_title.justification: SCT is directly cited in the context of this research.
referenced_paper_title.quote: All quantitative assessments were done automatically using the Spinal Cord Toolbox (SCT).
